thread.title: Delaware Valley's Hannah Bonaguidi and North Hunterdon girls both champs at Skyland cross country
thread.title_full: Delaware Valley's Hannah Bonaguidi and North Hunterdon girls both champs at Skyland cross country

title: Delaware Valley's Hannah Bonaguidi and North Hunterdon girls both champs at Skyland cross country
text:
Complete Box Score » 
Skyland Conference girls cross country championship -- Rapid Recap 
One local gold medal came as expected at the Skyland Conference championships Thursday afternoon at Natirar Park in Peapack and Gladstone. 
The other local gold was rather completely unexpected. 
Delaware Valley senior Hannah Bonaguidi , the pre-race favorite, followed up her championship at Hunterdon/Warren/Sussex with an absolutely dominating performance Thursday, finishing first by 38 seconds in 18 minutes and 15 seconds. 
North Hunterdon’s girls delivered the unexpected result by grabbing the team title with 52 points and knocking off the state’s top-ranked teams, Ridge (59) and Hillsborough (64) to do so. The Lions had four runners in the top 16, led by second-place Anna DiMarcello in 18:53. 
Turning point: North’s Ellie DiMarcello and Angela Kearsley finished almost together in seventh and eighth place to give the Lions three runners in while Ridge and Hillsborough had only two each. 
Top performer: Bonaguidi took off a half-mile into the race on the hill in front of the handsome Natirar mansion and was never touched after that. 
What it means: For Bonaguidi, a tremendous individual triumph in one of the best cross country conferences in the East, much less the state. And North Hunterdon has served notice that there’s a new sheriff in town – and a new No. 1 in both region and state. 
Brad Wilson may be reached at bwilson@lehighvalleylive.com . Follow him on Twitter @bradwsports . Find Lehigh Valley high school sports on Facebook .
